Combat

Turn-based tactical combat system

Combat Structure

Initiative

Determines turn order in combat:

  • Roll 1d20 + Dexterity modifier
  • Order from highest to lowest
  • Ties: Higher Dexterity wins, then coin flip
  • Initiative order stays same for entire combat

Rounds and Turns

  • Round: 6 seconds of game time
  • Turn: Each creature gets one turn per round
  • On your turn: Move + Action + Bonus Action (if available)
  • Between turns: Can use Reaction

Your Turn

On your turn, you can:

  • Move up to your Speed
  • Take one Action (Attack, Dash, Disengage, Dodge, Help, Hide, Ready, Search, Utilize, Magic)
  • Take one Bonus Action (if you have an ability that grants it)
  • Interact with one object for free (draw weapon, open door, etc.)
  • Communicate briefly

Movement in Combat

  • Can split movement before, during, and after actions
  • Moving through hostile creature space requires check
  • Moving out of reach provokes Opportunity Attack
  • Difficult terrain costs extra movement
  • Standing from Prone costs half your Speed

Attacks

Attack Rolls

Formula: 1d20 + ability modifier + proficiency bonus (if proficient)

  • Compare to target's AC
  • Equal or higher = hit
  • Natural 20 = Critical Hit (double damage dice)
  • Natural 1 = automatic miss

Melee Attacks

  • Range: 5 feet (or weapon's Reach)
  • Use Strength (or Dexterity for Finesse weapons)
  • Disadvantage if enemy within 5 feet of you uses ranged weapon

Ranged Attacks

  • Range: Normal/Long (e.g., 80/320 ft)
  • Use Dexterity (or Strength for thrown weapons)
  • Disadvantage at long range
  • Disadvantage if enemy within 5 feet

Spell Attacks

  • Melee Spell Attack: 1d20 + spellcasting modifier + proficiency
  • Ranged Spell Attack: Same, but ranged
  • Spell Save DC: 8 + spellcasting modifier + proficiency

Damage

  • Roll damage dice when you hit
  • Add ability modifier to damage (usually same as attack)
  • Critical hits: Roll damage dice twice
  • Resistance: Take half damage
  • Vulnerability: Take double damage
  • Immunity: Take no damage

Cover

Cover TypeAC BonusDEX Save Bonus
Half Cover+2+2
Three-Quarters Cover+5+5
Total CoverCan't be targetedCan't be targeted

Conditions in Combat

Common combat conditions:

  • Prone: Disadvantage on attacks; melee attacks against you have Advantage
  • Grappled: Speed = 0
  • Restrained: Speed = 0, attacks have Disadvantage, attacks against you have Advantage
  • Invisible: Attack rolls have Advantage, attacks against you have Disadvantage
  • Blinded: Can't see, fail sight checks, attacks have Disadvantage, attacks against you have Advantage

Ending Combat

Combat ends when:

  • All enemies defeated, dead, or fled
  • Party surrenders or flees
  • Peaceful resolution reached
